description:
The anime centers on Minoa Asagaya, a new high school student in Sakaneko Private High School. Despite being a novice to anime, Minoa's classmate Arisu Kamiigusa invites her to make an "anime research club" at school. Through conversations with her classmate Miko Kouenji, as well as various anime-loving upperclassmen, Minoa gradually gets hooked on anime. While they stand against the student council's continuous efforts to disband their club, and they ignore the impending end of the world, they talk about anime, whether in Akiba, or in real-life "sacred place" anime settings, or the hot springs.

(Source: Anime News Network)

tags.name: Otaku Culture
tags.description: Centers around the culture of a fanatical fan-base.

tags.name: School Club
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a school club scene.

tags.name: Meta
tags.description: Features fourth wall-breaking references to itself or genre tropes.

tags.name: Surreal Comedy
tags.description: Prominently features comedic moments that defy casual reasoning, resulting in illogical events.

tags.name: School
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a primary or secondary educational institution.

tags.name: Cosplay
tags.description: Features dressing up as a different character or profession.

tags.name: Chuunibyou
tags.description: Prominently features a character with "Middle School 2nd Year Syndrome", who either acts like a know-it-all adult or falsely believes they have special powers.

tags.name: Primarily Teen Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of teen characters.

tags.name: Butler
tags.description: Prominently features a character who is a butler.

tags.name: Ojou-sama
tags.description: Features a wealthy, high-class, oftentimes stuck up and demanding female character.

tags.name: Urban Fantasy
tags.description: Set in a world similar to the real world, but with the existence of magic or other supernatural elements.

node.description:
[Twitter](https://x.com/KeigoHoashi)

Keigo Hoashi is a composer and arranger, and a pianist. He was formerly part of the unit [MONACA](https://anilist.co/staff/110481/MONACA).

[Website](https://www.garnidelia.com) | [YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCAYfguaShVaNDU561_jJoOQ) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/garnidelia)

__Members:__ female vocalist [MARiA](https://anilist.co/staff/102307/Mai-Mizuhashi) (Mai Mizuhashi), composer [toku](https://anilist.co/staff/160034/Yoshinori-Abe) (Abe Yoshinori)

The duo first collaborated on the song "Color," which was used as the opening theme to the 2010 anime _Freezing_. The name of their unit came from the French phrase "Le Palais Garnier de Maria" (Maria's Opera), and the asteroid Cordelia, which was discovered in 1978, the year of Toku's birth.

In 2014, they made their debut under major record label Defstar Records with the single "ambiguous," which was released on March 5, 2014. Its title track was used as the second opening theme to the 2013 anime _Kill la Kill_.

__Agency:__ I'm Enterprise

[Agency Profile](https://www.imenterprise.jp/profile.php?id=78) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/Hondo_dagaya_)

A Japanese voice actor affiliated with I'm Enterprise.

Hondo had an interest in anime from a young age, in particular the [Naruto](https://anilist.co/anime/20/) series. She became interested in acting and modelling while in elementary school. She made her voice acting debut in 2015, and later that same year, she was cast in her first main role as [Kokoro Yotsuba](https://anilist.co/character/134716/), the protagonist of the anime series [Kamisama Minarai: Himitsu no Cocotama](https://anilist.co/anime/21237/).

She won Best New Actress at the 13th Seiyuu Awards for her role as [Hitomi Mishima](https://anilist.co/character/89230/).

**Non-anime roles:**
- Lunalynn - Memento Mori (VG)
- Novel - Goddess of Victory: Nikke (VG)
- Ciel - Tsukihime -A piece of blue glass moon- (VN)
- Voyager - Reverse: 1999 (VG)
- Ajitani Hifumi - Blue Archive (VG)
- Phoebe - Wuthering Waves (VG) 
- Motoha Arai - Persona 5: The Phantom X (VG)

[Profile (MONACA)](http://www.monaca.jp/staff/takahashi.html)

Japanese composer and arranger working for music production company MONACA since 2013. He is a graduate of Hokkaido University of Education.

[Website](https://monaca.jp/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/MONACA_jp)

__MONACA__ is a Japanese music production studio, which was established by the composer Keiichi Okabe in October 2004.

__Members__:
• [Keiichi Okabe](https://anilist.co/staff/121585/Keiichi-Okabe) (CEO)
• [Satoru Kousaki](https://anilist.co/staff/101555/Satoru-Kousaki)
• [Ryuuichi Takada](https://anilist.co/staff/109459/Ryuuichi-Takada)
• [Kakeru Ishihama](https://anilist.co/staff/150946/Kakeru-Ishihama)
• [Hidekazu Tanaka](https://anilist.co/staff/141852/Hidekazu-Tanaka)
• [Keiichi Hirokawa](https://anilist.co/staff/156490/Keiichi-Hirokawa)
• [Kuniyuki Takahashi](https://anilist.co/staff/154774/Kuniyuki-Takahashi)
• [Shuotarou Seo](https://anilist.co/staff/317330/Shoutarou-Seo)
• [Oliver Good](https://anilist.co/staff/317296)
• [Keita Inoue](https://anilist.co/staff/229376/Keita-Inoue)

__Past Members__:
• [Yuri Mitsumi](https://anilist.co/staff/201236/Yuri-Misumi)
• [Keigo Hoashi](https://anilist.co/staff/111233/Keigo-Hoashi)
